result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber J. Smith

[MK]  cases #19CF210, #20CF20, #20CF240, #21CF282, #21CF442, #21CF499, #21CM343, #21CM344, #21CM354, #22CF28, #22CF130, #22CF298 called at 9:23am 
Defendant Amber J. Smith does not appear. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[Cases #21CF499 and #22CF28 are set for Arraignments;  Case #22CF130 and #22CF298 are set for Preliminary Hearings, and the remaining cases are set for Status Conference today.] 
Attorney Rumpf does not have information regarding the non-appearance.
The Court issues Warrants-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.
recess 9:25am .

Pre-trial conference on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK]  cases #19CF210, #20CF20, #20CF240, #21CF282, #21CF442, #21CF499, #21CM343, #21CM344, #21CM354, #22CF28, #22CF130, #22CF298 called 3:17pm 
Defendant Amber J. Smith appears with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
Ms. Smith indicates that her address is:  W6604 County Road J, Jefferson 

Initial Appearance is held in Cases #22CF130 and #22CF298: 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond in each case, with conditions: 
--no presence at the Ace Hardware store in Lake Mills
--no presence at any Kwik Trip in the State of Wisconsin
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 3:29pm 

NEXT:   (1) clerk- remove the Waukesha County Jail from the mailing matrix; Ms .Smith is no longer in custody,  (2) Pretrial Conference on August 17th at 9:00am,  (3)  Arraignments in Cases #21CF499 and #22CF28, and Preliminary Hearings in cases #22CF130 and #22CF298, and Status Conference on the remaining --all on September 13th at 9:00am

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #19CF210, #20CF20, #20CF240, #21CF282, #21CF442, #21CF499, #21CM343, #21CM344, #21CM354, #22CF28, #22CF130 called 9:01am 
Defendant Amber J. Smith appears by telephone from the Waukesha County Jail, in custody. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Rumpf indicates that she has just learned this morning that Ms. Smith is in the Waukesha County Jail.  She not been able to meet with Ms. Smith, but intends to set up a meeting.  Attorney Rumpf requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference; the Defense is awaiting a plea offer from the State. 
The Court will conduct the Arraignments [Cases #21CF499, #22CF28] and the Initial Appearance [#22CF130] when Ms. Smith appears in person at the next hearing date.  
The Court directs the State to prepare a proposed writ by end of business tomorrow.  The Court directs Waukesha County Sheriff is to comply with the writ and release Ms. Smith to the JESO deputies for transport. 
recess 9:05am 

NEXT:  Arraignment in Cases #21CF499, #22CF28, Initial Appearance in #22CF130, and Status Conference in the remaining cases--all on July 28th at 3:00pm; the State is to prepare a writ

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #19CF210, #20CF20, #20CF240, #21CF282, #21CF442, #21CF499, #21CM343, #21CM344, #21CM354, #22CF28, #22CF130 called 3:51pm 
Defendant Amber J. Smith appears from the Rock County Jail, in custody. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the Zoom connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
Case #19CF210 is scheduled for Final Status Conference today, and for Jury Trial next week.  However Attorney Rumpf requests adjournment, indicating that she has not been able to meet with Ms. Smith, and that she intends to request a global plea offer for the cases.  
The Court cancels the Jury Trial date in Case #19CF210.
Scheduling is discussed. Because Attorney Rumpf was unable to meet with Ms. Smith, the Court will conduct the Arraignments [Cases #21CF499, #22CF28] and the Initial Appearance [#22CF130] at the next hearing date.  The Court cancels the warrant authorization in Case #22CF130.
Ms. Smith indicates that she anticipates release from the Rock County Jail in the next couple days; she will then return to the W6604 County Road J, Jefferson address. 
recess 3:56pm 

NEXT:  Arraignment in Cases #21CF499, #22CF28, Initial Appearance in #22CF130, and Status Conference in the remaining cases--all on June 23rd at 9:00am
Arraignment on April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.  {Converted to Zoom. -AR}

[ma] Cases 21CF499 & 22CF28 called at 8:39am[All Appearances via Zoom]
Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Amber J. Smith does NOT appear.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 
Atty Rumpf has no explanation for Ms. Smith's non-appearance. 

ADA Shock requests warrants issue. 
The Court authorizes bench warrants, stays issuance to 9:00am.

recess: 8:40am 
Ms. Smith is transferred into the zoom meeting by JA at 8:41am; enters breakout room with Attorney Rumpf
reconvene: 9:01am
Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amber J. Smith appears via audio means. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs in Cases 21CF499 & 22CF28:
Ms. Smith waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

recess: 9:04am 
[Post Hearing//Off Record: The Court asserts warrant authorization is vacated]

NEXT:   Arraignment on 4/12/22 at 3:30pm
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:37pm[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Amber J. Smith appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel) appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance.
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $100 CASH Bond with conditions:
--no presence at Festival Foods in Fort Atkinson

recess 1:47 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 2/4/22 at 8:30am
